alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:33AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Ferry County through 815 AM PDT... At 732 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 21 miles south of Sherman Pass, or 44 miles east of Omak, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Ferry County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding along the western perimeter of the Summit Trail Burn Scar. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
